title: Thai Coconut Chicken Curry with Zucchini & Radish

metadata.reheating: Stovetop gentle simmer; loosen with a splash of water.
metadata.pairing: Jasmine rice or basmati rice; fresh herbs

items.notes: optional but helps round the flavor
red or yellow (or use DIY blend below)

steps.title: Bloom the paste
steps.step: Heat oil over medium. Add curry paste and sautÃ© 1â€“2 minutes until fragrant.

steps.title: Aromatics
steps.step: Add garlic, ginger, and onion. Cook until softened.

steps.title: Chicken
steps.step: Add chicken slices and stir-fry until just starting to color.

steps.title: Coconut
steps.step: Pour in coconut milk, stir to combine, and bring to a gentle simmer.

steps.title: Season
steps.step: Add soy/fish sauce, sugar, and a pinch of paprika (optional).

steps.title: Veggies
steps.step: Add zucchini and radish. Simmer 10â€“12 minutes until chicken is tender and sauce slightly thickens.

steps.title: Finish
steps.step: Taste and balance: add lime juice for brightness, more fish/soy sauce for salt, or a little more sugar for sweetness. Serve over rice and garnish with herbs.

If you donâ€™t have jarred paste, mix: paprika or chili powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander (optional), garlic (fresh or powder), ginger (fresh or powder), soy sauce, plus a squeeze of lime and a pinch of sugar.
Turn it into a paste with a spoonful of oil or coconut milk, then use it as your base.
